website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy off-road model that can handle gravel, dirt, and grass.
pros: This model stands out with its 8-inch inflated tires, which can handle a variety of terrain
The sturdy frame works well for older kids
cons: A few customers had issues with the inner tubes of the tires losing air

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with the front wheel.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scooter for my 15 year old son. He wanted something with a strong frame, that would hold up well. It seems like a very strong, sturdy scooter, but after only riding it a couple of times (on the street, nothing rough), something is wrong with the front wheel. It's loose, and he can't ride it. I'm not finding a way to get replacement parts, or a number to call. He had an old worn out scooter, of a different brand, and he switched the wheels. The wheel from the other brand is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Choose a Different Scooter
customer_reviews.text: There were two significant issues with this scooter, so I returned it. 1) The brake on the back wheel did not work. The brake consisted of a very thin piece of metal that the rider pushes against the tire to slow down. However, the brake on this scooter model was so thin and flimsy that it didn't "bounce back". Instead it stayed depressed against the tire. My impression is that this is a design flaw rather than a one-off issue. 2) Another design issue is that the tires are nearly impossible to inflate because of the location of the stem. My strong recommendation is that you save yourself some hassle and choose a different scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scooter handle is loose and cannot go straight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scooter off of Walmart.com becuase it was slightly cheaper than here on Amazon, but it sucks. I had to return it. The handle bar was not properly connected to the wheel shaft, so hat even if I held the handle straight and kicked forward, the wheel would rattle and turn in multiple directions plus or minus 1 cm from directly straight. Simply put, the scooter could not go straight, which is the most basic functionality of a scooter. I would not recommend it.

product_meta.title: Pulse Performance Products DX1 Freestyle Dirt Scooter, Black/White
product_meta.description: The Pulse Performance DX1 All-Terrain Scooter is designed for scooter riders of all ages, abilities and levels. The heavy-duty construction and oversized 8” knobby, air filled tires handle the impacts of riding on or off-road. The grip tape deck surface of the Pulse Performance DX1 All-Terrain Scooter holds the rider’s feet safely in place while riding on any surface. Oversized aluminum deck allows for multiple riding positions and easy control at all times.
feature_bullets: 2-wheeled freestyle kick scooter with oversized knobby tires for on and off pavement
8 in. air-filled knobby tires with ABEC-5 bearings absorb shocks and ride over obstacles
Polished stainless steel rear foot brake stops easily and BMX-style grips enhance comfort
Sturdy steel frame with reinforced heat-treated aluminum deck adds durability and allows grinding
Designed for riders 8 years and older, weighing up to 180 lbs.
